SEARCH
Package grafioschtrader.priceupdate

Class ThruCalculationHelper

java.lang.Object
grafioschtrader.priceupdate.ThruCalculationHelper
public abstract class ThruCalculationHelper extends Object
Helper class for calculating historical price data for derived financial instruments.

A derived product's price is calculated from one or more underlying instruments, optionally using a mathematical formula. Only through a derived instrument does a currency pair become tradable; in this case the instrument has no formula.

Formula System:

  • Primary linked security uses variable 'o' (defined in SecurityDerivedLink.FIRST_VAR_NAME_LETTER)
  • Additional securities use variables 'p', 'q', 'r', 's'
  • Formulas evaluated using EvalEx expression library
  • Example: "(o + p) / 2" averages two instruments

All linked instruments must have quotes for the same dates. Missing data from any linked instrument prevents calculation for that date.

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • loadDataAndCreateHistoryquotes

      public static List<Historyquote> loadDataAndCreateHistoryquotes(SecurityDerivedLinkJpaRepository securityDerivedLinkJpaRepository, HistoryquoteJpaRepository historyquoteJpaRepository, IFormulaInSecurity security, Date correctedFromDate, Date toDateCalc)
      Loads historical data for linked instruments and creates calculated history quotes.

      Retrieves historical quotes for all linked instruments and generates calculated quotes based on the security's formula (if present) or by copying prices directly.

      Parameters:
      securityDerivedLinkJpaRepository - repository for retrieving additional instrument links
      historyquoteJpaRepository - repository for loading historical quotes
      security - the derived security for which to calculate quotes
      correctedFromDate - start date for historical data retrieval
      toDateCalc - end date for historical data retrieval
      Returns:
      list of calculated Historyquote entities with HistoryquoteCreateType.CALCULATED

    • fillGaps

      public static List<Historyquote> fillGaps(SecurityDerivedLinkJpaRepository securityDerivedLinkJpaRepository, HistoryquoteJpaRepository historyquoteJpaRepository, IFormulaInSecurity security, Date maxDate)
      Fills gaps in historical price data for a derived security by calculating missing end-of-day quotes.

      Identifies dates where all dependency securities have data but the derived security doesn't, then calculates and creates new historyquote entries using the security's formula and dependency data.

      Parameters:
      securityDerivedLinkJpaRepository - repository to fetch additional security dependencies
      historyquoteJpaRepository - repository to query missing historical quotes
      security - the derived security that needs gap filling
      maxDate - the maximum date to check for gaps (inclusive)
      Returns:
      list of newly created historyquote entries, ordered by date descending

    • createIdSecurityToVarNameMap

      public static Map<Integer,String> createIdSecurityToVarNameMap(IFormulaInSecurity security, List<SecurityDerivedLink> securityDerivedLinks)
      Creates mapping from linked security IDs to formula variable names.

      Maps the primary linked security to variable 'o' and additional links to their configured variable names ('p', 'q', 'r', 's').

      Parameters:
      security - derived security with primary link
      securityDerivedLinks - additional linked securities with variable assignments
      Returns:
      map of security ID to variable name for formula evaluation

    • checkFormulaAgainstInstrumetLinks

      public static void checkFormulaAgainstInstrumetLinks(Security security, String localeStr) throws com.ezylang.evalex.parser.ParseException, com.ezylang.evalex.EvaluationException
      Validates that security's formula correctly references all linked instruments.

      Ensures formula contains required variables and all variables correspond to valid links:

      • Formula must contain primary variable 'o'
      • Formula must contain variable for each additional link
      • All link variable names must be in allowed set ('p', 'q', 'r', 's')
      • Formula must evaluate successfully with test values
      Parameters:
      security - the security with formula and derived links
      localeStr - locale for error message translation
      Throws:
      com.ezylang.evalex.parser.ParseException - if formula syntax is invalid
      com.ezylang.evalex.EvaluationException - if formula cannot be evaluated
      DataViolationException - if formula missing required variables or using invalid variable names
